title: Getting flamed for buying a sightsone
body:
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1618821191/224818519

For reference


So, I was trying out maoki for the first time in pvp, no one wanted to jungle so I tried him out.  Early on was great I was able to gank all 3 lanes successfully, I built a spirit golem with a visage, i noticed that we never had wards, so I decided that I'll buy a sightstone instead of spending so much gold on wards i'll get a little health and some rechargeable wards.  My Sejuani thought otherwise and let me know it throughout the game that I am a fkin #$%! (I have the filter turned on so insert profanity there).  

We had no vision ever, I didnt want to get caught in my jungle; no one else was making a real effort to ward. I'm sure I could have used it to buy maybe some other item, but the reality is I wasn't getting melted by their vayne when ever I dove in, and even when 3 of us dove her lulu and her team were able to keep her alive, meanwhile our lucian and ahri would attack their sejuani resulting in 3 of us getting cc'ed and killed and eventually them as well.

He/she tried to pin our whole loss on my inability to kill vayne and buying the sightstone was the reason I couldn't take her down, and that I'm a fkin #$%!.

I don't understand why I never see it being used, or why I have to take harassment from various other players if  if I buy one.  The only lane where I havn't bought one on a character in pvp is when I play ashe, ive used it in the middle before when the other team had an aggressive jungler. 

This is the third time ive had this happen by some random person who thinks they are gods gift to league of legend. Why is there a constant need for these people to do this.  This same guy would try to jump in and 1v3 because someone was at low health, and he would end up dying forcing us to fight an eventual 4v5.

I would never flame somebody for getting a sightstone, especially a jungler. (though I don't really flame at all so that might not mean much).

That said, even though sightstone does pay for itself eventually (fairly quickly if you're using it right) there's a reason it's not bought by every player on every champion in every role, and that's because it slows down your build. Supports build it because champions are chosen for support on the grounds of not really needing stats, but for everyone else dumping 800 gold for 150 HP means you'll be a lot less powerful than someone else who just spent 225 to buy three wards and put the rest into their main build. Certain junglers don't mind that, for example Lee Sin has really powerful early game damage without stats and gets extra advantages from being able to use the wards for jumps. But on everybody else buying a sightstone means you're less powerful than you could be in a fight for at least your next three backs.

To be fair, placing the gold into non-combat stats is only really an issue early in the game.  He said that he had already finished Spirit of the Ancient Golem and Spirit Visage (and presumably boots), so at that point losing 400g in combat stats wasn't that big a setback for his build.

Junglers who can get away with purchasing an early sightstone are typically utility junglers (like Nunu, Rammus) and counterjunglers (Elise, Lee Sin).  It may not always be optimal, but it can be a good decision depending on your playstyle and your team.

I'm not exactly disagreeing with you, but after a couple major items are finished the 400g lost for free wards is pretty insignificant.

@OP.  I wouldn't worry about it.  Purchasing a sightstone was a good decision and the Sejuani likely would have raged at you anyways, since most people like that are only looking for an excuse to argue they weren't the reason the game was lost.

Level 1-20ish don't really understand the importance of wards IMO. As you get further into the game, you'll see these particular people less and less.

Also a jungler that knows how to ward is amazing as far as I'm concerned. (And was this Sej the support? Because nobody has any utility items [or wards] and she's the likeliest candidate.) As a support main, I've learned more about warding from good junglers in three ranked games than I have in a year of playing normals.

As far as how to stop it, mute and report. It sucks but eventually it'll stop.

My opinion is that site stone is fine on champs with some utility spells and are going tanky, especially if they're going around the map a lot. Maokai jungle fits that role just fine.  Even Maokai mid with a site stone would be circumstantially fine, as long as your team isn't relying on you as their sole source of AP damage.  I 100% wouldn't pick up the sitestone if you're playing apc or adc though, just because your team is relying on you to do heavy damage, and other defensive items are much better.

*The point people seem to deliberately refuse to understand*, is that if you're already dominating with any build, and your opponent isn't doing anything to mitigate your build (which is 70% of all games), then there is no reason you should re-calibrate your build to defeat a strategy not being used.  As long as you've completed your core build and you keep winning and you feel like you need wards, build Sightstone.  If you need wards earlier, but haven't completed the core build, then build a Sightstone if you want to take that gamble.

I've seen too many people who complain about lack of wards (even after the support getting her own sightstone), yet refuse to get a sightstone or buy the upgraded yellow trinket, that it makes me sick.

Also you should know that the on hit effects won't get reflected back to you when you attack a champion with a Thornmail.
So if you autoattack a tank as Malphite for example and he has a Thornmail and you have 200 AD and a BotRK, you'd only get 30% of your AD reflected to you as magic damage, which's 60 magic damage. (not counting in your own magic resist)
So you won't receive (8x0,3) 2,4 % current health of Malphite back as magic damage every autoattack.

> can you go a little more indepth on what you mean by the term power spike?  I just started watching videos from the LCS season  4 and I heard them use that term as well.

A "power spike" just refers to any point where a champ spikes significantly in power, typically because they hit a certain level, granting them access to a certain skill or their ultimate, or because they got an item that compliments them significantly.  Some examples:

- When Ashe gets Infinity Edge, the automatic crit from her passive becomes really scary for enemy champs, which is why you try to rush IE on her.
- When Akali hits level 6, her ultimate allows her to roam and gank very efficiently.
- When Ezreal gets Trinity Force, he becomes a much stronger duelist.

These are pretty obvious/extreme examples, but almost all champs hit power spikes.  As a player, you should strive to learn when the champs you play are at their strongest relative to the champs you are facing.  If you have a champ whose power spikes most significantly after she gets her first full item, facing someone who needs two or three items to really become monstrous, you want to start bullying that champ once you get that item, because that's your best window to beat them into submission and snowball to victory!

Anyway, back to my original point about Sightstone: unless you are building toward an item that clearly helps you to hit a power spike, buying a Sightstone is fine.  A lot of players, and most bad players, underestimate the value of vision on the map.  Every time a ward helps you avoid being ganked, think of that as preventing the other team from getting kill gold.  Every time a ward helps you gank someone who is out of position, think of that gold as a return on the investment you made when you bought that ward.  Sightstones are, over a long game, VERY gold efficient.  They just delay you getting to your item-based power spikes, so it's a compromise you have to consider before making it.
In a game where vision is as important as it is, I don't see how anything could be considered wrong with it...Especially if no one else is dropping wards...

Honestly sightstone is a bad buy.  Not flame worthy bad, but by no means good.  It's a double problem.   

If you're at a low enough ELO that you're needing to compensate that bad ward wise, it's not just placing wards it's remembering to place them and if people are even watching the map.  Both your lack of optimal use combined with people not paying attention anyway devalue the wards. 

 If you're aware enough to use your sightstone effectively you're prob at a high enough ELO where you're teams warding anyway and dueling \ countergank power is going to be more valuable.

Buying wards will almost always be a better solution on either side of the coin.
